org.multiverse.api
Interface Stm

All Known Implementing Classes:
AlphaStm
public interface Stm

The main interface for software transactional memory. Updates/reads in the stm should only be done through the Transaction interface. So see that for more details.

Essentially the Stm is a transaction factory.

This interface is made for a shared clock based stm's. When in the future the shared clock is dropped, this interface needs to be refactored or a new framework needs to be created.

It is important that an atomic object only is used within a single stm.

Author:
Peter Veentjer.

Method Summary
 long getClockVersion()
          Returns the current clock version.
 Transaction startReadOnlyTransaction(String familyName)
          Starts Transaction that only can be used for readonly access.
 Transaction startUpdateTransaction(String familyName)
          Starts a Transaction that can be used for updates.
 

Method Detail

getClockVersion

long getClockVersion()
Returns the current clock version. 0 represents the initial state. In the future this could be implementation dependant.

Returns:
the current clock version.

startUpdateTransaction

Transaction startUpdateTransaction(String familyName)
Starts a Transaction that can be used for updates. The family name should be a string that uniquely identifies transactions that execute the same logic. Based on the family name the stm could do all kinds of optimizations like returning transaction implementations optimized for this type of transaction.

See the AtomicMethod for more information.

Parameters:
familyName - the familyName of the Transaction.
Returns:
the created Transaction.

startReadOnlyTransaction

Transaction startReadOnlyTransaction(String familyName)
Starts Transaction that only can be used for readonly access. Updates are not allowed while using this transaction and will cause a ReadonlyException to be thrown.

Parameters:
familyName - the familyName of the Transaction.
Returns:
the created readonly Transaction.
